meanings.definition: An article in a newspaper or magazine expressing the opinion of the editor or publisher.
meanings.sent1: The editorial in the newspaper shared the editor's viewpoint on the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: I always read the editorial section to understand the newspaper's stance on current issues.
meanings.sent3: The editorial about cats wearing hats was both amusing and informative.
meanings.sent4: Her editorial on climate change was a powerful call to action for the community.
meanings.sent5: The editorial painted a vivid picture of the local government's inefficiency.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the commissioning or preparing of material for publication.
meanings.sent1: The editorial team worked tirelessly to ensure the magazine's content was top-notch.
meanings.sent2: She received recognition for her editorial skills in selecting compelling stories for the journal.
meanings.sent3: The editorial process can be both challenging and rewarding for writers.
meanings.sent4: His editorial approach to editing manuscripts was meticulous and thorough.
meanings.sent5: The editorial decisions made by the team greatly influenced the magazine's success.
